summary: you’ve probably already done this but please give some bakugou and jirou friendship headcanons
question: you’ve probably already done this but please give some bakugou and jirou friendship headcanons
answer:
Surprisingly, I don’t think I’ve done these two yet!

  • They became secret best friends after the cultural festival arc. Shhhh don’t tell Kirishima.
  • They meet up every weekend to jam out together. Their little garage band actually gets pretty good and they start performing at cafe’s and small venues. They have a cult following.
  • Sometimes they have lunch together and sit in complete silence the whole time. They give off such a unique anti-social energy that whenever they do this no one else will sit with them.
  • They love to make fun of Kaminari together. Usually when one of them calls out his idiot ass the other will immediately join in and they’ll savage him together.
  • Jirou forced Bakugou to join the class group chat just so she could send him obscure memes in the conversation that only he would get and that would purposely confuse everybody else.
  • She eventually convinced him to go to a dance class with her and now Bakugou loves classic ballet and hip-hop dancing. As with everything he is incredibly talented and the tearchers were shook when they saw him perform.
  • They make a music video together and it goes viral. That’s how the rest of 1-A finds out Bakugou can dance.

summary:

body:
Villain who has captured class 1-A + Shinsou: Don’t do anything stupid Eraser or you will die.

Aizawa: Bold of you to assume that I want to live.

summary: Ummmmmm if you ship these 3 together could I get Headcanons for ojiro x yuuga x Shinsou I ship them so hard but like there is no...
question: Ummmmmm if you ship these 3 together could I get Headcanons for ojiro x yuuga x Shinsou I ship them so hard but like there is no content for them at all
answer:
I have never thought about this shop before, however, now I think about it they are pretty adorable. As a messy multishipper with no preferences I love hearing about your obscure ships!

  • Ojiro and Aoyama started dating first. They get together at the end of second year.
  • Shinsou joins the couple in the begining of their third year. He just liked Ojiro at first and was invited into the relationship after some predictable misunderstandings and hijinks.
  • After dating them for a while he started to like Aoyama too and now they are a poly couple that all loves one another.
  • Aoyama will sometimes walk into the common room at Shinsou and Ojiro are napping together. When this happens he first takes adorable blackmail pics, then he paints their nails with glitter polish.
  • When they went on their first date as a trio they went to a coffee shop and Ojiro was so nervous he accidentally knocked over the whole table and spilled coffee everywhere.
  • Shinsou will randomly take control of Bakugou during classes and make him dance for Aiyana’s amusement (and his own,) Ojiro disapproves.
  • Aoyama and Shinsou are chaotic good boys and they give lawful good Ojiro daily heart attacks.

blog.name: bakugou-loving-hours
blog.title: Are Always Open
blog.description: The name's Rev. I'm 23, nb or genderfluid, queer, she/her/they/them mostly. Bakugou is my boy! Follow back from Pink-hair-revolution.

tags: this is me trying to write an entire au in 500 words or less
I kinda wanna see where this goes
title: 21. Free Prompt- AU
body:
Pairing: Kirishima/ Bakugou

Rating: Mature

Word Count: 513

Summary: Kirishima knows how to set Bakugou free.

Additional Tags: CW: gang violence?, Nurse Kirishima, Son of Gang Boss Bakugou

AU

This was how it worked in Bakugou’s world. His dad told him to be somewhere, intimidate someone, shoot up someplace. And… he did it. It didn’t matter if he didn’t want to, couldn’t bring himself to do it, or whatever. He found a way to get it done.

And Kirishima… he patched him up afterwards. There was always some awful cut or scrape or, god forbid, gunshot wound, that needed his attention. Kirishima was the only one that Bakugou would allow to touch him. The only person he trusted. So he did it.

He’d steal supplies and drugs from his hospital. Risk life and liberty to make sure Bakugou lived. And he could barely understand why at first. Why when this bitchy pain in the ass came into his ER, he just bonded to Kirishima immediately. And afterwards, he kept coming back. Back to Kirishima to be fixed and healed.

They started meeting outside the hospital. Once for coffee. Three times for debilitating wounds.

Bakugou wasn’t just some gang leader’s son. He wasn’t just a thief, a hired gun, the muscle. He had aspirations, dreams, and surprisingly a soft side. Kirishima started to understand why Bakugou did this.

He didn’t really have a choice. Because if he did… he would have been a cop. Doing the exact opposite of what he does now. And making sure he did it right, keeping people safe, making sure his streets were clean and secure.

He was a good man, trapped in a bad man’s world.

Kirishima fell in love.

And the progression to sex just kind of happened. The ‘I’m glad we’re alive’ sex was too often and followed by weeks worth of care and laying low. Kirishima would get his shifts covered and they’d stay in so he could treat Bakugou’s wounds. Care for him, like no one else did.

It was not in Kirishima’s life plan. To be the subject of kidnapping threats and the target of people trying to get to the boss’s kid. He wanted to be a nurse and help save lives. Instead he had to go into hiding every few weeks because the rival gang wanted Bakugou dead, and subsequently Kirishima.

But he stuck to it. Would continue to stick to it, stay by Bakugou’s side until he decided to run away. Or worse…

“I can’t do this anymore Ei.”

Kirishima knew this line. Knew this fight, “You can. And you will.”

He knew that Bakugou would cut himself off from the things he loved. Knew he would deny himself access to Kirishima, because he didn’t think he deserved him. Knew that it stemmed from some off-handed comment his dad made.

“I’m gonna get you killed.”

He also knew the only way to end it. To put a stop to all of the suffering Bakugou had to endure. To give them a good life.

“Bakugou, I love you,” he replied.

Bakugou disappeared after that

And that was what Kirishima needed. To get a meeting with the boss. To push a knife through the monster’s chest. To help Bakugou be free.

Summary: Kirishima knows how to set Bakugou free.

Additional Tags: CW: gang violence?, Nurse Kirishima, Son of Gang Boss Bakugou

AU

This was how it worked in Bakugou’s world. His dad told him to be somewhere, intimidate someone, shoot up someplace. And… he did it. It didn’t matter if he didn’t want to, couldn’t bring himself to do it, or whatever. He found a way to get it done.

And Kirishima… he patched him up afterwards. There was always some awful cut or scrape or, god forbid, gunshot wound, that needed his attention. Kirishima was the only one that Bakugou would allow to touch him. The only person he trusted. So he did it.

He’d steal supplies and drugs from his hospital. Risk life and liberty to make sure Bakugou lived. And he could barely understand why at first. Why when this bitchy pain in the ass came into his ER, he just bonded to Kirishima immediately. And afterwards, he kept coming back. Back to Kirishima to be fixed and healed.

They started meeting outside the hospital. Once for coffee. Three times for debilitating wounds.

Bakugou wasn’t just some gang leader’s son. He wasn’t just a thief, a hired gun, the muscle. He had aspirations, dreams, and surprisingly a soft side. Kirishima started to understand why Bakugou did this.

He didn’t really have a choice. Because if he did… he would have been a cop. Doing the exact opposite of what he does now. And making sure he did it right, keeping people safe, making sure his streets were clean and secure.

He was a good man, trapped in a bad man’s world.

Kirishima fell in love.

And the progression to sex just kind of happened. The ‘I’m glad we’re alive’ sex was too often and followed by weeks worth of care and laying low. Kirishima would get his shifts covered and they’d stay in so he could treat Bakugou’s wounds. Care for him, like no one else did.

It was not in Kirishima’s life plan. To be the subject of kidnapping threats and the target of people trying to get to the boss’s kid. He wanted to be a nurse and help save lives. Instead he had to go into hiding every few weeks because the rival gang wanted Bakugou dead, and subsequently Kirishima.

But he stuck to it. Would continue to stick to it, stay by Bakugou’s side until he decided to run away. Or worse…

“I can’t do this anymore Ei.”

Kirishima knew this line. Knew this fight, “You can. And you will.”

He knew that Bakugou would cut himself off from the things he loved. Knew he would deny himself access to Kirishima, because he didn’t think he deserved him. Knew that it stemmed from some off-handed comment his dad made.

“I’m gonna get you killed.”

He also knew the only way to end it. To put a stop to all of the suffering Bakugou had to endure. To give them a good life.

“Bakugou, I love you,” he replied.

Bakugou disappeared after that

And that was what Kirishima needed. To get a meeting with the boss. To push a knife through the monster’s chest. To help Bakugou be free.
